data.title: Lala Kent flaunts baby bump in white dress as she joins Vanderpump Rules co-star Scheana Shay and co-host Garcelle Beauvais at Miss USA 2024
data.meta_description: The Bravo-lebrities glammed up to watch Miss Michigan Alma Cooper be crowned Miss USA during The CW telecast held at the Peacock Theater in downtown LA on Sunday
data.text:
Bravo-lebrities Lala Kent, Scheana Shay, and Garcelle Beauvais glammed up to attend the 73rd annual Miss USA Pageant, which was held at the Peacock Theater in downtown LA on Sunday.

Lala (born Lauren Elyse Burningham) showcased her bourgeoning baby bump in a clingy white maxi-dress, featuring a halter design and single right sleeve, along with a matching pair of peep-toe heels.

The expecting 33-year-old is scheduled to give birth on September 1 - the day before her 34th birthday - and she'll co-parent the baby girl (whose name begins with 'S') with her live-in mother Lisa Burningham.

'I'm surprised I've kept [her name] a secret for this long,' Lala - who famously conceived via intrauterine insemination - marveled during her Amazon Livestream last Friday.

'Although at Sutton [Stracke's] show, the Green Label show that I went to last week, Erika [Jayne] goes, "Do you have a name?" And I have not told anybody, you guys, and I just blurted it out to her. And she was mic'd! There are some people who just get things out of me.'

Kent continued: 'No one's guessed [her name]. That's the best part about it. And it's, like, how do I reveal it? Do I post a picture of the baby with the name? Or do I reveal the name after I've finished breastfeeding and I get the [name] tattooed? There are so many ways.'

The Give Them Lala podcaster's three-year-old daughter Ocean was enjoying quality daddy-daughter time on Sunday with her estranged ex-fiancé Randall Emmett, whom she bitterly split from in 2021 after three years amid cheating allegations.

Joining Lala on the red carpet was her Vanderpump Rules co-star Scheana, whom also attended her July 14th baby shower.

Kent and Shay are arguably the closest friends in the current cast of The Real Housewives of Beverly Hills spin-off considering they are the only parents.

On April 30, Bravo announced that its Emmy-nominated reality show would pause production for a full year, and the Utah-born beauty and the 39-year-old Scheananigans podcaster originally joined the cast as hostess and server at Lisa Vanderpump's restaurant SUR in 2015 and 2013.

Scheana was wearing a black-and-nude corset peplum with a black mini-skirt featuring a long dramatic train and matching stilettos heels.

Shay (born Jancan) overlined her lips, defined her brows, and wore extra long Viva Verano lashes for The CW telecast.

Joining the Sweet & Sour singer on the red carpet was her second husband Brock Davies, who flashed his chest hair and wore ornate high-heeled boots with his all-white white suit.

Scheana and the 34-year-old Kiwi-born Aussie are proud parents of three-year-old daughter Summer Moon Honey, and he fathered daughter Winter and son Eli from a prior relationship.

Shay also reunited with The Valley star Jasmine Goode and Vanderpump Rules star Ally Lewber, the live-in girlfriend of their co-star James Kennedy, who was DJ-ing Canadian music festival Chasing Summer.

The half-Mexican SoCal native served as one of the seven judges for the beauty pageant where the winner will represent the States at Miss Universe 2024 to be held in Mexico.

Meanwhile, Garcelle easily defied her 57 years in a completely sheer black feathered gown and matching pumps selected by stylist Oliver Brown.

Beauvais wore her burgundy wig styled in a partial updo by hairstylist Abena ShearPhysique, and she had fully contoured complexion by make-up artist Natalie Malchev.

The Real Housewives of Beverly Hills star co-hosted Miss USA 2024 alongside E! News' Keltie Knight.

Garcelle also went completely sheer for her onstage attire - a bejeweled dress over a black leotard, massive shoulder wrap, and matching platform heels.

Beauvais - a former teen model - later changed into a purple-sequin halter cocktail dress onstage.

Miss USA 2023 Savannah Gankiewicz - who replaced Noelia Vogit after she relinquished her title in May due to her mental health - passed the crown to the winner, Miss Michigan Alma Cooper.

The multi-racial 22-year-old Army Lieutenant from Okemos is currently pursuing a master's degree in statistics (data science track) at Stanford University.

Alma made sure to pose with the newly-crowned Miss Teen USA 2024 Addie Carver as well as Miss USA 1953 Myrna Hansen, who's celebrating her 90th birthday this Monday.

Cooper also posed with all seven judges - Filipino designer Jojo Bragais, Miss USA 1994 Lu Parker, motivational speaker Natasha Graziano, Anastasia Beverly Hills CEO Anastasia Soare, Scheana, APL managing partner NJ Falk and Miss USA 1990 Carole Gist.

Meanwhile, YouTube sensation Patrick Starrr and Miss USA 2022 Morgan Romano served as the golden girl-style commentators throughout the competition.
